p: Sex variations on food consumption, relative liver weight, relative left kidney weight, relative right kidney weight and urea and albumin concentrations could not be explained based on this study. Most parameters showed higher values in males compared to females. Similarly, higher TG, ALP, ALT, and glucose levels were reported in male Sprague-Dawley rats compared to females [ 49, 50]. Male mice had also been reported to have higher TG, cholesterol, high-density lipoprotein cholesterol, glucose, and amylase values [ 51].
